messages.title: FAIR IS WORTH FIGHTING FOR
messages.content: Anthony Lochmuller has lived in Northampton for over twenty years. He has often stood for the Green Party in local elections.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Green MPs will demand a 'Living Wage' to ensure low paid workers earn enough to provide for themselves and their families. We will fight for a fair banking system, with community banks, credit unions and mutually providing realistic loans to families and small businesses.

Green MPs will ensure an insulation scheme for every single home to cut fuel bills. A green party can put a green energy cap at local level and create a million new jobs around the country us such a scheme in Kirklees.
Green MPs will fight to make sure all people are free easy to localised care with truly local hospitals and surgeries, GPs and private others close by.

mentions.candidate: Anthony believes that this has led to the credit crunch, global warming and damages the environment.
mentions.partyLeader: Green Party leader and MEP Caroline Lucas receives the prestigious MEP Award 2008 for work on MEP of the Year 2008 for her work on trade.

issues.economy: It is possible to re-build the economy and protect the planet's future. Even so, all the major political parties still follow the idea that a growing economy – using up valuable resources to produce more things – is the only way forward.
issues.environment: Our 'green' policies on climate change, renewable energy and recycling were established well before the main political parties had embraced these crucial issues.

leaflet.personalStatement: He knows that the right way forward should be to create a greener economy instead. This is the only way to protect more jobs and make sure society as a whole benefits, not just the few. We need less focus on the money markets and more help for local businesses.

images.caption: Anthony Lochmuller with a child in a healthcare setting

leaflet.additionalNotes: Printed on 100% recycled paper using sustainable technologies that do not harm the environment.
